meanings.definition: A person who sells cheap or inferior goods.
meanings.sent1: The cheapjack set up a stall at the market to sell his low-quality products.
meanings.sent2: The town was full of cheapjacks selling fake designer handbags.
meanings.sent3: The cheapjack tried to pass off plastic jewelry as real gold, but no one was fooled.
meanings.sent4: Beware of the cheapjack in the alley, his goods may look shiny but they're worthless.
meanings.sent5: The cheapjack's reputation for selling shoddy goods spread quickly throughout the town.

meanings.definition: Of poor quality or low cost.
meanings.sent1: The cheapjack toys fell apart after just a few minutes of play.
meanings.sent2: She bought a cheapjack watch that stopped working after a week.
meanings.sent3: The cheapjack umbrella flipped inside out at the first gust of wind.
meanings.sent4: The cheapjack furniture looked nice but was made of flimsy materials.
meanings.sent5: The cheapjack shoes were uncomfortable and fell apart after a few wears.

meanings.definition: To sell cheap or inferior goods.
meanings.sent1: He decided to cheapjack his old electronics to make some quick cash.
meanings.sent2: The street vendor would cheapjack knockoff handbags to unsuspecting tourists.
meanings.sent3: She tried to cheapjack her homemade candles at the craft fair, but no one was interested.
meanings.sent4: The scam artist would cheapjack fake antiques to collectors looking for a bargain.
meanings.sent5: The market was flooded with vendors trying to cheapjack their goods to passersby.
